page.title: 15THE HAILSHAM MUSEUM
page.content:
{ The museum was built in the late {19th century, and was originally a {private home.It was not used as a {museum until 1960.
The museum is a very small one. The oldest relic is a{pre-cambrian fossil about 450 million years old. In an old cauldron there were some{Stone Age flint tools, such as axe heads, scrapers and hammer stones. The latest aquisition is an old wooden till that still works. You press any button and the drawer opens. They have got an old selection of weaponry and ammunition. There is a horse pistol used about 1790 , a bayonet used during World War I and two different sized cannon balls. The artefacts are donated to the museum by the finder. The Historic Society decide whether it is geniune.
